article_node.title: A disgruntled worker built his own kill-switch malware to take down his former employer - and it didn't pay off
article_node.summary: A former software developer, Davis Lu, was sentenced to four years in prison after installing a killâ€‘switch malware that locked out users and crashed servers at his employer following a demotion. The Java program created infinite loops, deleted data, and caused hundreds of thousands of dollars in damage. Lu was arrested after the kill switch triggered when he surrendered his laptop, underscoring the need for early detection of insider threats.
